ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to view and think about films in conjunction with the time period they were made in. Often it is easy to see what you want to see in a film, but this class really helped me think about what the purpose of film was in the time that it was made. I also learned different ways to analyze films and different relevant film techniques

This was the first class I had taken with a "cultural history" approach, which was very valuable. I also learned skills pertaining to film analysis, a welcome addition to my toolbox coming from a more traditional historical background.
I reviewed several topics of American history and learned more in-depth about a couple of events and films through assignments discussions, etc

I get to know how American cinema developed in different periods of history and read a certain historical context in various representative movies. Moreover, Carolyn has given us many sources to look for the information we need and taught me how to use citations correctly.
Film analysis tools, American history overview, and key American films.
learned a lot more about film and its role in dictating cultural trends across decades

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: strength - super understanding and nice professor, interesting classes and discussions

Strengths: Carolyn and M were amazing teachers. They structured the course well, facilitated student discussion, provided helpful feedback, returned assignments in a timely fashion, were funny and friendly...
Weaknesses: Can we get off Zoom already? I've had it with this pandemic. Apart from that no big problems. The course doesn't go super in-depth with of any particular historical period or event, but I expected that so wasn't disappointedthe focus is more on how film and media connect to and reflect the historical period.

Getting to "choose your own adventure" in terms of assignment topics and format was excellent. While I won't say I enjoyed doing work, the work was interesting and allowed me to learn more about history I'm personally interested in. Ample time was provided in class to discuss assignments and ask questions which was also beneficial. At times it was hard to choose what to write about for the weekly movie responses and while I think having it open to talk about whatever you want is great and should stay, including a question or two to help guide those who are unsure might be helpful.

Strengths: This course gives students many opportunities to watch and discuss movies, which is more attractive than ordinary subject courses for students who love culture and art. At the same time, because the teacher can provide very rich resources for movies, this course is suitable to online teaching and thus can attract more international students.

Weakness:  Sometimes the enthusiasm of group discussion is not high

How to improve: Teachers can use more PPT and upload it on Canvas for students to review after class

No major weaknesses other than noting that I did not feel spending classtime working on projects was productive and the reception assignment was difficult because it was a group assignment but the course was virtual.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes!!!! Really fun class, also low level of stress for a summer course which was nice
Yeah, it worked well as a summer class. As a history major, I found it a fun opportunity to engage with another discipline.
Definitely, this was an enjoyable class with very personable instructors. I enjoyed watching most of the films on the syllabus and learned more about American history.
For any student interested in Film this is a great class to help contextualize the historical dimension of American film trends.

Definitely, I will.
First of all, the teachers are really great and you can learn a lot through their guidance.
Second, you can gain a good understanding of how to interpret movies in a historical context, which will open up a new dimension for you to watch them.
Yes, with the understanding that it seemed more like a history course than a film studies course.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.

Strongly Agree
Strongly Agree
